Story #1

  • February 24, 2021
  • Zizi

It was a sunny spring day. Lots of snow was everywhere around our house and my father was sawing wood. I remember seeing his back just before I started walking on a sidewalk with a ball. I was around 4, I guess. The sidewalk was wooden and lied on the water, which was a part of a swamp beside the road. I walked on the sidewalk and suddenly my ball fell into the water. I looked down and saw a piece of snow going from the sidewalk on the water, looking like an extension, which can help to get the ball back. Then I looked at my father’s back, made a step on that snow and the time slowed down. I fell into the water, luckily grabbed the wooden sidewalk with one arm and pulled myself out of that swamp. I was fully wet and immediately ran home and hid in the corner behind the armchair. I don’t know how much time I spent there, but I was so scared of my mother finding me there wet. But I got luck and my father found me and changed the clothes.

I’m sure you guessed that led to bad relations with the water.

After that first episode I sank 4 more times.

Once in a swimming pool. My mother was teaching me how to swim. There were some children with their mothers around. And when I start swimming towards my mother she did not pay attention to me and I got under the water on the bottom of a pool. I saw her legs and I started walking to them, when I touched them I started climbing on my mother’s body up to get the air. That was the first and the last time learning to swim with her.

Another time we were few kids in a deep lake on a pumped truck wheel. I slid in the hole in the center. Got luck to be caught by the hand of a girl before sank too deep. I remember the sunlight coming through the muddy water of the lake and a thought “This is it. This is the end of this life.”

Once I was washed away from my mother’s back laying on a pool float with a wave created by her husband coming on another float. Again got luck to be caught by my mother’s hand.

And the last: I thought I knew how to swim good enough being taught by a friend and I set a challenge to swim through a fast wide river. I almost made it to the other side, but got very tired, tried to grab a tree branch, but it broke and the river almost swallowed me. Got luck by grabbing the river bank with my hands and finally got on it.

And the last adding to this is a couple of memories of the past lives being drowned in a river. It is an agony to be under the water by force of hands holding your neck and whole body under the water till your last moment.

All that brought me to the feeling of insecurity, tension and sometimes panic attacks being in the water.
